===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|くじら|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=くじら}}. {{IPAchar|/kudira/}} → {{IPAchar|/kud͡ʑira/}}

Ultimate derivation unclear. Theories include an alteration from {{ja-l|口}}{{ja-l|広}} (''kuchibiro'') in reference to the wide mouth; an alteration from {{ja-l|口}}{{ja-l|開く}} (''kuchibiraku'') in reference to the gaping mouth; and an alteration from {{ja-l|黒白}} (''kuroshiro'') in reference to the black-and-white coloration of certain [[cetacean]]s.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|くじら|acc=0|acc_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|くじら|クジラ|hhira=くぢら}}

# a large marine mammal belonging to order [[w:Cetacea|Cetacea]]: a [[whale]]
#: {{ux|ja|ref=<ref>{{RQ:Wamyō Ruijushō|8|3}}</ref>|鯨 鯢 唐韻云、大魚、雄曰鯨、渠京反、雌曰鯢、音蜺、'''久知良''' [...]}}
#: {{ux|ja|ref=<ref>{{RQ:Nippo Jisho|165}}</ref>|'''Cujira'''. (鯨) 鯨.}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いさ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=いさ}}. Root ''isa'' (“powerful?”) shared with verb {{m|ja|勇む|tr=isamu||to be courageous, to be in high spirits}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いさ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いさ}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=いさ}} a large marine mammal belonging to order [[w:Cetacea|Cetacea]]: a [[whale]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|鯨|いさな}}, {{ja-r|勇魚|いさな}}: [[whale]] {{qualifier|see below}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いさな}}
From cognate ''isa'' above, suffixed with {{m|ja|魚|tr=-na||fish}}. Sometimes spelled as {{ja-l|勇魚}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いさな}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|勇魚}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いさな}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic|sort=いさな}} a large marine mammal belonging to order [[w:Cetacea|Cetacea]]: a [[whale]]
#* {{RQ:Manyoshu|13|3339}}; [http://etext.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man13Yo.html#3339 text here]
#*: 玉桙之 道尓出立 葦引乃 野行山行 潦 川徃渉 '''鯨名'''取 海路丹出而...
#*:: 玉桙の 道に出で立ち あしひきの 野行き山行き にはたづみ 川行き渡り '''鯨魚'''取り 海道に出でて...<br/>たまほこの みちにいでたち あしひきの のゆきやまゆき にはたづみ かはゆきわたり '''いさな'''とり うみぢにいでて...
#*:: ''Tamahoko no / michi ni idetachi / ashi hiki no / no yuki yama yuki / niwatazumi / kawa yuki watari / '''isana''' tori umiji ni idete...''
#*:: Heading out on the jeweled-spear road, going through the alluring fields and mountains, crossing the puddles and rivers, taking to the '''whal'''ing sea road ...

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鯨取り|いさな とり}}, {{ja-r|勇魚取り|いさな とり}}: [[whaling]]; an [[epithet]] for the [[sea]]
{{der-bottom}}
